questions.question: Crime is

choices.answer: An offence which is punishable by law eg stealing/Murder
Done legally to somebody found guilty of breaking a law
Actions that are opposite to good - destructive against God
Cheating on your wife or husband/not honouring your parents

questions.question: What does the quote from Bible Proverbs ‘Spare the Rod, Spoil the Child’ mean?

choices.answer: Children are spoiled
Physical Punishment is necessary to reform and deter
Do not punish your child
Punishment is necessary to teach discipline

questions.question: To which aim of punishment does the bible quote ‘An eye for an eye’ refer?

choices.answer: reformation
Deterrence
retribution
reparation

questions.question: Punishment is

choices.answer: An offence which is punishable by law
The opposite of Good - destructive and against God
Harsh punishment to put the prisoner off committing crimes
Something done legally to those found guilty of breaking law

questions.question: Jesus says forgive 'seventy times seven' = this agrees with punishment aim of..

choices.answer: Obligation
Retribution
Reformation
Deterrence

questions.question: Christians believe God gave humans 'Free Will' so they think ...

choices.answer: Its Gods fault that there is suffering and crime.
Crime is caused by wrong choices/not obeying God =punishment
Free will does not cause crime and suffering
People who commit crime should not be blamed/punished

questions.question: Which is/are causes/reasons for crime...

choices.answer: Poverty - Greed
Mental illness - Opposition to an unjust law
Addiction - Hate
All of these

questions.question: Reasons why capital punishment should not be reintroduced which is the odd one out?

choices.answer: Deterrence - people put off doing crimes which get death
Mistakes can be made - eg D Bentley pardoned after execution
Only God can take a life - Life is sacred
CP has not been proven to have a deterrent effect

questions.question: Which of these bible quotes supports prisoner reformation

choices.answer: 'For the wages of sin is death'
'An eye for an eye'
'Forgive...not seven times but seventy seven times'
'Whatever measure you deal out to others will be dealt back'

questions.question: One of the aims off punishment is Deterrence - this is ...

choices.answer: to put people considering doing crime of doing it
To change a criminals behaviour for the better
to help an offender put something back into society
To protect the public from from being harmed by criminals

questions.question: The aim of punishment most Christians agree with is ...

choices.answer: Retribution,
Deterrence
Protection
Reformation

questions.question: Maureen Greaves and Gee Walker - Christians who's loved ones were murdered -  Quote to use ...

choices.answer: Forgive us our sins, as we forgive those who sin against us
Whoever sheds human blood ....their blood shall be shed
An eye for an eye
To practise forgiveness is the true fast...and contentment

questions.question: "Whoever sheds human blood, by humans shall their blood be shed" <sub>Genesis 6:6  </sub>quote to use for

choices.answer: The death penalty
Life imprisonment
Community Service
Corporal punishment

questions.question: Sanctity of Life means

choices.answer: Killing people for crimes they commit is OK
People can take life - it does not belong to anybody
How good a life is - if its not a good life then end it
Human life is holy & created by God - only God can take it

questions.question: Religious offences can also be crimes - Which are purely religious offences not crimes?

choices.answer: Blasphemy -  cursing or showing contempt of God
Murder - the taking of life
Adultory - cheating on your husband or wife
Do not Steal

questions.question: Here are some arguments for reintroducing the death penalty - which one is incorrect!

choices.answer: Saves money - cost to the taxpayer is £40,000 a year each
To get revenge = an eye for an eye/Stops them doing it again
Sanctity of Life
Deterrent - puts people considering doing a murder off it

questions.question: Community service is an example of ...

choices.answer: Deterrence
Retribution
Reformation
Repatriation

questions.question: The Charleston church shooting is a good example to use to show how Christians ...

choices.answer: Believe in revenge and capital punishment
Respond to suffering and belief in forgiveness
Think that suffering caused by humans is all Gods fault
Should not help others who are suffering

questions.question: Retribution is

choices.answer: Getting revenge - your own back eg death penalty/prison
changing the offenders behaviour eg group therapy/education
Putting other people thinking about crime off doing it
Protecting people from criminals by putting them in prison

questions.question: An example of a country that practices corporal punishment is

choices.answer: France
America
Saudi Arabia
The United Kingdom
